oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Atlas of the city of Nashville 1908. [Plate 22A]
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 1 map; 58 x 75 cm. A plat map of downtown Nashville, Tennessee and the surrounding area, originally published in 1908 by G. M. Hopkins Company, showing the various buildings, landscapes, acreage, and street routes for several blocks. Original building structures are depicted on the map, such as American Syrup and Preserving Company, Rothschilds-Lusky Manufacturing Company (labeled as Furniture Factory on the map), Tennessee Cotton Oil Company, Liberty Mills, Nashville Warehouse Company, St. Patrick's Church and School, Trimble School, Meharry Medical College, Walden University (labeled as Central Tennessee College on the map), Freedman's Aid Society (labeled as Freedman's Aid and Educational Society), numerous warehouses and the Nashville City Cemetery. Portions of the Nashville, Chattanooga, and St. Louis Railway, and the Louisville and Nashville Railroad are also included on the map, as is the Fort Negley property. This plat map is reproduced from the source: Atlas of the city of Nashville, Tennessee : from official records, private plans and actual surveys, G. M. Hopkins, [Philadelphia, Pa.] 1908. Scale 200 feet to an inch. The original dimensions of the map, in the atlas publication: 15 1/2 x 22 3/4 in. (i.e. 58 x 75 cm.)
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: American Syrup and Preserving Company (Nashville, Tenn.); Rothschilds-Lusky Manufacturing Company (Nashville, Tenn.); Tennessee Cotton Oil Company (Nashville); Liberty Mills (Nashville, Tenn.); Nashville Warehouse Company (Tenn.); St. Patrick's Church (Nashville, Tenn.); Trimble School (Nashville, Tenn.); Meharry Medical College; Central Tennessee College; Nashville City Cemetery (Nashville, Tenn.); Nashville, Chattanooga, and St. Louis Railway; Louisville and Nashville Railroad Company; Freedman's Aid Society; Walden University (Nashville, Tenn.)
